2.text: Truly—ye are the people, And with you doth wisdom die.

3.text: I also have a heart like you, I am not fallen more than you, And with whom is there not like these?

4.text: A laughter to his friend I am: ‘He calleth to God, and He answereth him,’ A laughter is the perfect righteous one.

5.text: A torch—despised in the thoughts of the secure Is prepared for those sliding with the feet.

6.text: At peace are the tents of spoilers, And those provoking God have confidence, He into whose hand God hath brought.

7.text: And yet, ask, I pray thee, One of the beasts, and it doth shew thee, And a fowl of the heavens, And it doth declare to thee.

8.text: Or talk to the earth, and it sheweth thee, And fishes of the sea recount to thee:

9.text: ‘Who hath not known in all these, That the hand of Jehovah hath done this?

10.text: In whose hand is the breath of every living thing, And the spirit of all flesh of man.’

11.text: Doth not the ear try words? And the palate taste food for itself?

12.text: With the very aged is wisdom, And with length of days understanding.

13.text: With Him are wisdom and might, To him are counsel and understanding.

14.text: Lo, He breaketh down, and it is not built up, He shutteth against a man, And it is not opened.

15.text: Lo, He keepeth in the waters, and they are dried up, And he sendeth them forth, And they overturn the land.

16.text: With Him are strength and wisdom, His the deceived and deceiver.

17.text: Causing counsellors to go away a spoil, And judges He maketh foolish.

18.text: The bands of kings He hath opened, And He bindeth a girdle on their loins.

19.text: Causing ministers to go away a spoil And strong ones He overthroweth.

20.text: Turning aside the lip of the stedfast, And the reason of the aged He taketh away.

21.text: Pouring contempt upon princes, And the girdle of the mighty He made feeble.

22.text: Removing deep things out of darkness, And He bringeth out to light death-shade.

23.text: Magnifying the nations, and He destroyeth them, Spreading out the nations, and He quieteth them.

24.text: Turning aside the heart Of the heads of the people of the land, And he causeth them to wander In vacancy—no way!

25.text: They feel darkness, and not light, He causeth them to wander as a drunkard.
